about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian who is:

about.name: Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian who is:

hasPart.assesses: Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian who is: | Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian who is: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Drivers must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians who are crossing the street in any marked or unmarked crosswalk. In the interest of safety, drivers should yield the right-of-way to people crossing any street.

comment.text: In a marked crosswalk.
In any crosswalk or intersection.
Crossing any street.
Crossing any street.

answerExplanation.text: Drivers must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians who are crossing the street in any marked or unmarked crosswalk. In the interest of safety, drivers should yield the right-of-way to people crossing any street.

comment.text: Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian who is: | Drivers must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians who are crossing the street in any marked or unmarked crosswalk. In the interest of safety, drivers should yield the right-of-way to people crossing any street.

hasPart.name: California's "Basic Speed Law" says you must:

about.name: California's "Basic Speed Law" says you must:

hasPart.assesses: California's "Basic Speed Law" says you must: | California's "Basic Speed Law" says you must: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: The "Basic Speed Law" states that you may never drive faster than is safe for current conditions. For example, if you drive at 45 mph in a 55 mph zone during a dense fog, even though you are below the posted limit, you may be cited for driving "too fast for conditions."

suggestedAnswer.text: Keep your speed close to that of other traffic.

comment.text: Keep your speed close to that of other traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: Never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.

comment.text: Never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.

suggestedAnswer.text: Always drive at the posted speed limit.

comment.text: Always drive at the posted speed limit.

acceptedAnswer.text: Never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.

comment.text: Never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.

answerExplanation.text: The "Basic Speed Law" states that you may never drive faster than is safe for current conditions. For example, if you drive at 45 mph in a 55 mph zone during a dense fog, even though you are below the posted limit, you may be cited for driving "too fast for conditions."

comment.text: California's "Basic Speed Law" says you must: | The "Basic Speed Law" states that you may never drive faster than is safe for current conditions. For example, if you drive at 45 mph in a 55 mph zone during a dense fog, even though you are below the posted limit, you may be cited for driving "too fast for conditions."

hasPart.name: You should allow an extra cushion of space:

about.name: You should allow an extra cushion of space:

hasPart.assesses: You should allow an extra cushion of space: | You should allow an extra cushion of space: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Drivers of trucks, buses, vans, or any vehicles pulling campers or trailers may not be able to see you if you are driving directly behind them. Increase your following distance when driving behind one of these vehicles. Additionally, large vehicles can block your view of the road, so increase your following distance to look around the sides of the vehicle and see the road ahead.

comment.text: When following a station wagon.

suggestedAnswer.text: When following a driver who cannot see the rear of their vehicle.

comment.text: When following a driver who cannot see the rear of their vehicle.

suggestedAnswer.text: When following a small passenger car.

comment.text: When following a small passenger car.

acceptedAnswer.text: When following a driver who cannot see the rear of their vehicle.

comment.text: When following a driver who cannot see the rear of their vehicle.

answerExplanation.text: Drivers of trucks, buses, vans, or any vehicles pulling campers or trailers may not be able to see you if you are driving directly behind them. Increase your following distance when driving behind one of these vehicles. Additionally, large vehicles can block your view of the road, so increase your following distance to look around the sides of the vehicle and see the road ahead.

comment.text: You should allow an extra cushion of space: | Drivers of trucks, buses, vans, or any vehicles pulling campers or trailers may not be able to see you if you are driving directly behind them. Increase your following distance when driving behind one of these vehicles. Additionally, large vehicles can block your view of the road, so increase your following distance to look around the sides of the vehicle and see the road ahead.

hasPart.name: When driving on a multilane street with two-way traffic:

about.name: When driving on a multilane street with two-way traffic:

hasPart.assesses: When driving on a multilane street with two-way traffic: | When driving on a multilane street with two-way traffic: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Driving directly alongside another vehicle could create a collision if the other driver crowds your lane or tries to change lanes without looking. To avoid this, you should drive ahead of or behind vehicles in other lanes rather than alongside them.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive alongside other vehicles so the drivers can see you.

comment.text: Drive alongside other vehicles so the drivers can see you.

suggestedAnswer.text: You should drive ahead of or behind the other vehicles.

comment.text: You should drive ahead of or behind the other vehicles.

suggestedAnswer.text: It is safest to drive in the lane next to the centerline.

comment.text: It is safest to drive in the lane next to the centerline.

acceptedAnswer.text: You should drive ahead of or behind the other vehicles.

comment.text: You should drive ahead of or behind the other vehicles.

answerExplanation.text: Driving directly alongside another vehicle could create a collision if the other driver crowds your lane or tries to change lanes without looking. To avoid this, you should drive ahead of or behind vehicles in other lanes rather than alongside them.

comment.text: When driving on a multilane street with two-way traffic: | Driving directly alongside another vehicle could create a collision if the other driver crowds your lane or tries to change lanes without looking. To avoid this, you should drive ahead of or behind vehicles in other lanes rather than alongside them.

hasPart.name: This road sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This road sign means: | This road sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers of an upcoming steep hill. Drivers should adjust their speed accordingly to avoid collisions and brake damage.

comment.text: Intersection ahead.
Merging traffic.
Steep hill ahead.
Steep hill ahead.

answerExplanation.text: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers of an upcoming steep hill. Drivers should adjust their speed accordingly to avoid collisions and brake damage.

comment.text: This road sign means: | Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers of an upcoming steep hill. Drivers should adjust their speed accordingly to avoid collisions and brake damage.

hasPart.name: Never make a U-turn:
hasPart.assesses: Never make a U-turn: | Never make a U-turn: - Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Never make a U-turn where a No U-turn sign is posted, at or on a railroad crossing, on a divided highway by crossing a dividing section, curb, strip of land, or two sets of double yellow lines, when you cannot see clearly for 200 feet in each direction, on a one-way street, in front of a fire station, never use a fire station driveway to turn around, in business districts (the part of a city or town where most offices and businesses are).

comment.text: in residential districts.

suggestedAnswer.text: at or on a railroad crossing.

comment.text: at or on a railroad crossing.

suggestedAnswer.text: where there isn't a "No U-turn" sign posted.

comment.text: where there isn't a "No U-turn" sign posted.

acceptedAnswer.text: at or on a railroad crossing.

comment.text: at or on a railroad crossing.

answerExplanation.text: Never make a U-turn where a No U-turn sign is posted, at or on a railroad crossing, on a divided highway by crossing a dividing section, curb, strip of land, or two sets of double yellow lines, when you cannot see clearly for 200 feet in each direction, on a one-way street, in front of a fire station, never use a fire station driveway to turn around, in business districts (the part of a city or town where most offices and businesses are).

comment.text: Never make a U-turn: | Never make a U-turn where a No U-turn sign is posted, at or on a railroad crossing, on a divided highway by crossing a dividing section, curb, strip of land, or two sets of double yellow lines, when you cannot see clearly for 200 feet in each direction, on a one-way street, in front of a fire station, never use a fire station driveway to turn around, in business districts (the part of a city or town where most offices and businesses are).
